ground_truth.question: Did Siddhartha Gautama live before Bodhidharma?

questions: Was Siddhartha Gautama alive in earlier times than Bodhidharma?
Did Bodhidharma live after Siddhartha Gautama?
Was Siddhartha Gautama a mystic before Bodhidharma?
Did the era of Siddhartha Gautama precede that of Bodhidharma?
Was Siddhartha Gautama on earth before Bodhidharma?
Is Siddhartha Gautama's period earlier than Bodhidharma's?
Did Siddhartha Gautama exist prior to Bodhidharma?
Was Siddhartha Gautama's lifetime before Bodhidharma's?
Did Siddhartha Gautama's epoch precede Bodhidharma's?
Was Siddhartha Gautama a figure before Bodhidharma's time?
answers: Yes, Siddhartha Gautama lived before Bodhidharma
Yes, Siddhartha Gautama's time predated Bodhidharma's
context: Mysticism is the belief that people can directly experience God or true reality, rather than through books, ritual or other people. People who practice this are called mystics. Mystics exist within most religions, though not all people who practice religions are mystics. Mystics may experience visions or dreams, or hear God as a voice. ==Hindu mystics== Some examples of Hindu mystics: :Shankara :Sri Ramakrishna ==Christian mystics== Some examples of Christian mystics: :Augustine of Hippo (354–430) :Gregory I (590–604) :Bridget of Sweden (1303–1373) :John of the Cross (1542–1591) :George Fox (1624–1691) :William Blake (1757–1827) :Thomas Merton (1915–1968) ==Islamic mystics== Islamic Mysticism is known as Tassawuf (or Sufism) and a detailed list of Muslim Sufi mystics is given on the Sufism page. ==Jewish mystics== Some examples of Jewish mystics: :Menachem Mendel Schneerson (1902-1994) ==Buddhist mystics== Some examples of Buddhist mystics: :Siddhartha Gautama (563 BC-483 BC) :Bodhidharma (440-528) ==Related page== *Spirituality Category:Theology Category:Reality
